com.kdkvit.wherewasi.sonitalk

Class SoniTalkContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kdkvit.wherewasi.sonitalk.SoniTalkContext

  • public class SoniTalkContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to create objects of the Encoder, Decoder and Sender. It handles the creation, initialization, updated and cancelation of notifications. Beside that the SoniTalkContext contains the request codes for the permission levels, granting and denying permission requests and checking if a send job is finished.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ON_PERMISSION_LEVEL_DECLINED
      Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user chose to "Decline" when asked for the privacy level.
      static int ON_REQUEST_DENIED
      Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user denied a permission request from the custom SoniTalk dialogs (L1/L2).
      static int ON_REQUEST_GRANTED
      Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when a request is granted, i.e.
      static int ON_REQUEST_L0_DENIED
      Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user denied a permission request from the Android permission system (L0).
      static int ON_SEND_JOB_FINISHED
      Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when a "send job" is finished, i.e.
      static int ON_SHOULD_SHOW_RATIONALE_FOR_ALLOW_ALWAYS
      Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user should show a rationale for the "Allow Always" (L0) SoniTalk permission.

    • Field Detail

      • ON_PERMISSION_LEVEL_DECLINED

        public static final int ON_PERMISSION_LEVEL_DECLINED
        Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user chose to "Decline" when asked for the privacy level.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_REQUEST_GRANTED

        public static final int ON_REQUEST_GRANTED
        Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when a request is granted, i.e. when the user gave permission to start receiving/sending (potentially sending several occurrences).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_REQUEST_DENIED

        public static final int ON_REQUEST_DENIED
        Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user denied a permission request from the custom SoniTalk dialogs (L1/L2). At least this callback (and ON_REQUEST_L0_DENIED) or ON_SHOULD_SHOW_RATIONALE_FOR_ALLOW_ALWAYS should be used to show some rationale to the user.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_SEND_JOB_FINISHED

        public static final int ON_SEND_JOB_FINISHED
        Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when a "send job" is finished, i.e. if a message was to be sent several times, after the last occurrence has been emitted.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_SHOULD_SHOW_RATIONALE_FOR_ALLOW_ALWAYS

        public static final int ON_SHOULD_SHOW_RATIONALE_FOR_ALLOW_ALWAYS
        Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user should show a rationale for the "Allow Always" (L0) SoniTalk permission. At least this callback or ON_REQUEST_DENIED should be used to show some rationale to the user.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_REQUEST_L0_DENIED

        public static final int ON_REQUEST_L0_DENIED
        Will be sent to the SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver when the user denied a permission request from the Android permission system (L0). At least this callback (and ON_REQUEST_DENIED) or ON_SHOULD_SHOW_RATIONALE_FOR_ALLOW_ALWAYS should be used to show some rationale to the user.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SoniTalkContext getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                                          SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver sdkListener)
        Instantiate a SoniTalkContext, allowing to create Encoder, Decoder and Sender objects.
        Parameters:
        context - is used to get an application context.
        sdkListener - ResultReceiver which will receive callbacks from SoniTalk. Please set the handler according to which thread should execute the callbacks (often the UI Thread if it handles UI components). Please call setReceiver and pass an object that implements SoniTalkPermissionsResultReceiver.Receiver interface in order to receive the callbacks (it can be an Activity, but then do not forget to set it back to null in onStop or onPause to avoid leaking your Activity on configuration changes).
        Returns:
        a SoniTalkContext, allowing to create Encoder, Decoder and Sender objects.

      • getDecoder

        public SoniTalkDecoder getDecoder(int sampleRate,
                                  SoniTalkConfig config)
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - is used to start the decoder with the correct sample rate
        config - can be generated with the utility class ConfigFactory and holds configurations for the decoder
        Returns:
        a new SoniTalkDecoder

      • getEncoder

        public SoniTalkEncoder getEncoder(SoniTalkConfig config)
        Parameters:
        config - can be generated with the utility class ConfigFactory and holds configurations for the encoder
        Returns:
        a new SoniTalkEncoder

        public SoniTalkEncoder getEncoder(int sampleRate,

        config - can be generated with the utility class ConfigFactory and holds configurations for the encoder

      • getSender

        public SoniTalkSender getSender()
        Returns:
        a sender object to transmit the encoded message of the encoder

      • getSender

        public SoniTalkSender getSender(int sampleRate)
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - is used to get a sender with the correct sample rate
        Returns:
        a new SoniTalkSender to transmit the encoded message of the encoder
